name: Three-Headed Clockwork Dragon
description: A massive dragon-like construct with three heads, showcasing complex clockwork mechanisms and a fierce metallic body capable of flight and fierce melee attacks.
memorable: Its unique Bond ability lets circlet-wearers experience its sensory perceptions, leading to potential exhaustion if connections are not maintained.
goals: To protect its circlet-wearers and dominate foes when not connected to them.
relations: Might work with or be controlled by spellcasters or engineers who created it.
environment: Often found in technologically advanced locations or ancient ruins.
strengths: Highly resilient to poison and psychic damage, resistant to magical effects, and capable of dealing devastating damage to structures.
weaknesses: Extremely low Charisma, making it ineffective in social contexts.
attacks: Multiattack with devastating bite and fist attacks, a fearsome fire breath that can engulf multiple foes, and an oil spray that creates vulnerabilities.
most_powerful_ability: Fire Breath allows for a powerful area attack that deals high fire damage in multiple cones, posing a threat to groups of enemies.
skills: Proficient in athletics, excelling in physical contests.
additional_information: Immune to alterations in its form through Immutable Form.
Can deal double damage to structures as a Siege Monster.
Telepathic connection allows for sensory sharing with circlet-wearers within a mile.
Exhaustion mechanics for circlet-wearers if connected.
Advantage on saving throws against spells due to Magic Resistance.
